life and marriage - Social stratification and groupings</topcClas>         <topcClas>Income, property and investment - Economics</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>Family Resources Survey, 1979</i> is a follow-up to the <i>Family Finances Survey, 1978</i> (FFS), conducted by the Department of Health and Social Security. All low-income families interviewed in the FFS were resurveyed 12 months later to look for changes or otherwise in financial circumstances. (The 1978 FFS is not currently available from the UK Data Archive). <br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The interview schedules used were very similar to those used in the original FFS interview but included in addition some qualitative measures of deprivation. However, the follow-up survey does not include expenditure diaries. See documentation for details (the FFS documentation is included within the user guide for this study). <br> </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="single" date="1979-01-01T00:00:00Z">1979</collDate>         <nation>Great Britain</nation>         <geogUnit>No spatial unit</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Families/households</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Consumers</universe>         <universe>Families</universe>         <universe>Households</universe>         <universe>Low income families</universe>         <universe>All low income families previously interviewed for the FFS in 1978.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Longitudinal/panel/cohort</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>two waves</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>Office of Population Censuses and Surveys. Social Survey Division</dataCollector>         <sampProc>No sampling (total universe)</sampProc>         <deviat>2,697 households.</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>No information recorded</weight>         <cleanOps>C</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Standard conditions of access</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply.
